algorithm_technique: Precompute primes using a sieve, then iterate through diagonals and check for primes.
problem_summary_simple: Find the largest prime number on either diagonal of a 2D array.
problem_summary_technical: Precompute primes up to MAX_N using a linear sieve. Iterate through diagonals, check if elements are in the prime set, and track the maximum prime.
key_insights: Pre-calculating primes up to the maximum possible value in the array is more efficient than checking primality for each number individually.
A set provides O(1) average time complexity for checking if a number is prime.
The problem requires checking both the main diagonal (i, i) and the anti-diagonal (i, n-1-i).
